title: No spoiler card
custom_preconds: Given: Users sets a delay
custom_expected:
1. The arrow does not spoil what happened during the current at bat until the delayed resolution comes in.
2. If a delay has been set by the player, then render a No Spoiler Card on top of the peeking card in the stack. 
3. The player can still swipe to the cards that are under the No Spoiler Card.
4. If the delay is removed, then the No Spoiler Card is also removed.
5. The no spoiler card should only show if the card is greater than the activeIndex (from the view model) in DeckViewController.

title: Earning XP
custom_preconds: GIVEN a game that a player is participating in ends
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks into that contest OR they are already in it
- note: If they have already seen the end of game flow for this contest, then clicking into the contest will just take the user to the card stack.
custom_expected:
THEN the user is shown the below screen and awarded XP.

title: EOG flow
custom_expected: User is able to see the EOG flow just once.

title: Scores Complete
custom_preconds: Given: A game, in which the user made a pick, has just completed
custom_steps:
When the user opens the app and is viewing the "Scores complete!" screen
And the user taps the "See My Score" button
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected to a series of screens that auto-advances
And the first screen shows the logos of the teams that have competed
And the next screen, "Your Final Results"
And the next screen shows the "Which team will win..." card
And the name of the team user picked displays, along with the number of points the pick generated
And that screen is then overlaid with a green screen "Correct" screen or a red (Incorrect) screen, if the pick was incorrect
And the rest of the screens flow by showing the original question and the correct (green) or incorrect (red) pick
And a "Total Points Earned" screen opens with the number of points, "Pick Accuracy" <Percent>, "Incorrect Picks" <value> & "Total Picks"
<value>
And the "Game Ranking" screen opens showing the user's points and place in the rankings <value> for that game
And the screen shows the user's place in the "Daily Rankings"
And the "Total XP Earned screen opens with the user's total XP
And the "Level Up" screen opens showing the user's "Total XP," a slide bar showing his/her progress and a level designation (e.g. Rookie)
And the screen redirects to a splash screen
And back to the stack of tiles for today's games
